_prev_prog_3.Description:
Rich Products Corporation - Fresno Facility's ammonia refrigeration is designed to minimize the potential of an ammonia release.There are two ammonia refrigeration systems (main refrigeration system and the #3 system) that are interconnected.  The facility has in place the following for the ammonia refrigeration system:  preventative maintenance procedures and records, automatic alarm systems, ammonia detectors and ventilation system, process safety information tracking logs, automatic system shutdown capabilities, periodic leak and pressure testing, periodic visual inspections, control valves, refrigeration hand service valves for manual operation, solenoid valves, pressure relief valves, computer generated work orders for maintenance, and hot work permits.

The facility's administrative procedures are as follows:  periodic training for Associates (employees), compliance audits, pre-startup safety checks, process hazard analysis to address what-if scenarios and the measures needed to mitigate a release,  screening of all contractors performing work on the ammonia refrigeration system per OSHA and USEPA regulations, emergency action plan, and management of change procedures.

Compressors have the following safeguards:  pressure and temperature gauges on suction and discharge piping, high and low temperature alarms and shutdown, high and low pressure alarms and shutdown, high and low level oil alarms and shutdown, high and low oil temperature alarms and shutdown, high and low oil pressure alarms and shutdown, thermosyphon oil cooling, discharge stop/check valve, suction valve (i.e., combination stop/check/strainer valve), electronic overload protection with alarm and shutdown conditions, and pressure relief valves.

The pressure vessels have the following safeguards:  dual pressure relief valves, high and low level alarms and shutdown, continuous level controller, high and low pressure alarms and shutdown, and liquid level sight glass.

Evaporative Condensers have the following safeguards:  dual pressure relief valves, high and low level alarms and shutdown, and high and low pressure alarms and shutdown.

Intercoolers have the following safeguards:   high and low level alarms and shutdown, temperature controls, liquid level alarm and shutdown, liquid level gauge, pressure relief valves, high and low pressure alarms and shutdown, emergency stop switch, and pressure and temperature gauges on suction and discharge piping.

The purger has the following safeguards:  pressure relief valve, check valves, shutoff valves, metering valves, water bubbler, and liquid level control valves.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Rich Products Corporation - Fresno Facility (RPC-FF) produces dough which is frozen for shipment by using an ammonia refrigeration system.  The RPC-FF ammonia refrigeration system contains approximately 31,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia which is liquified under pressure.There are two ammonia refrigeration systems (Main refrigeration system and the #3 system) that are interconnected.
  
RPC-FF endeavors to eliminate accidents and health hazards to Associates, customers, and the community by having procedures to provide Associates educational training, safe working conditions, and the means to increase awareness of potential dangers both on and off the job. RPC-FF's objective is to prevent unwanted releases of ammonia into locations that could potentially expose Associates or the community to serious hazards.  An effective program requires a systematic approach to evaluating the entire system.  Workplace and process safety are major concerns to management and Associates alike.  The prevention and mitigation of unwanted releases of ammonia into locations that could expose Associates and the community to serious hazards is of primary concern.   

RPC-FF has developed this program in accordance with OSHA Title 29 CFR 1910.119, USEPA Title 40 CFR Part 68, California Code of Regulations, Title 8, Chapter 4, Subchapter 7, Group 16, Article 109 (Cal/OSHA), and California Code of Regulations, Title 19, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 (CalARP).  The program is designed to inform all Associates of the hazards of ammonia, procedures for the safe use of ammonia, and the steps taken for the safety of Associates in the event of a release or spill (i.e., emergency action plan, management of change procedures, preventative maintenance program, Associate training, etc.).  In addition, Rich Products Corporation has developed "Rich Products Corporation Standards for Safety Performance" which outlines the corporate policy for safety policies, safety procedures, and sample programs to be impleme

nted at each Rich Products Corporation Facility.  

RPC-FF has had no accidental releases of ammonia in the past five years.  

RPC-FF has developed an emergency action plan in compliance with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 (n), OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38, USEPA 40 CFR 68.90, CalOSHA, and CalARP.  RPC-FF has coordinated all emergency response activities with the Fresno Fire Department and the Fresno Fire Department will perform all HAZMAT activities at the facility.  The emergency action plan establishes the procedures necessary to follow in case of an ammonia release as well as the order of notification for off-site responders.
